person.note: Chao(2) Buzhi [13] Yuanyou coalition. According to Zhang Lei's funerary inscription, the family desccended from Chao Cuo, but there was no genealogical record tracing the lineage between Han and the beginning of Song. Lei traces the Song lineage to Qingfeng residents, which firmly links both branches of the Chao, as does his following linkage of the Jiong->Zongque and the Zongjian->Zhongyan(2)->Buzhi. Duanyou's [3025] son. Buzhi's sons are Gongwei [3017] and Gongsi [3016]. Du(3) Chun's [1724] son-in-law, father-in-law of Li(2) Zhi(4) [999] . Another son-in-law, Li(2) Xiangru [3500], was also the grandson-in-law of Chao(2) Qianzhi's [10] father. Buzhi's third younger sister was the wife of Yan(4) Xun's [2068]'s grandson, Shimeng [4115]. Another sister's husband, a Suzhou 1076 jinshi Zhang(1) Yuanbi [3178], has the same address and generational name as Zhang(1) Mian's [262] grandsons. Yan(4) Deji [4116], the father-in-law of Chao(2) Buzhi's uncle, Duanben [3024], was probably kin with Yan(4) Xun [2068]. Yan(4) Shi married Duanben at the age of 19. She gave birth to seven sons, none of whom reached maturity, and she died at the age of 65. Her son-in-law was Du(3) Chun's [1724] son, Du(3) Kai [3918]. Chao Buzhi, WJ, 68.11a; Zhang Lei, WJ, 12.17a; XCB, 478.7a; Huang Tingjian, WJ, 23.4b; YLDD, 2368.4b; Du Dagui, zhong, 34.4b-6b. CBD, 3, 1953-4.

私諡文節先生 庭堅文章天成 與張耒、晁補之、秦觀俱游蘇軾門 天下稱為四學士 而庭堅尤長於詩
開化人 樸子 治平中與晁補之同學 後中進士第 為巴東縣主簿
